executive_summary: The Insect Repellent Manufacturing industry produces consumer products that deter insects from landing on a particular surface. Consumers purchase repellents to avoid insect bites and prevent insect-borne diseases. Industry products range from skin applicants to aerosol sprays for clothing. Over the five years to 2022, quelled fears of disease transmission and waning domestic manufacturing have contributed to a decline in industry revenue. Manufacturers are introducing plant-based repellents to attract environmentally conscious consumers and appeal to shifting tastes against potentially toxic chemical inputs. The industry has also experienced increased offshoring to low-income countries, undermining domestic manufacturing.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumers use insect repellents to prevent bug bites from mosquitos, ticks, fleas, various flies and other insects. Demand is typically higher in warmer regions with larger insect populations. As a discretionary expense, insect repellent sales are susceptible to changes in per capita disposable income and consumer spending. However, neither income nor spending increases sufficiently boosted demand for domestic manufacturers over the past five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Growth in disposable income will likely enable steady insect repellent sales over the next five years. Demand from pharmacies and drug stores is also poised for growth, underlining industry growth in the outlook period.

Industry operators are anticipated to continue focus on product development, mainly for plant-based repellents, as consumers increasingly demand more natural products. Operators moving away from petrochemical inputs will help mitigate exposure to rising oil prices.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures insect repellent for consumer use, including skin applicants, sprays and liquids. Consumers typically use industry products during outdoor recreation or long exposure to nature.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - steady

key_trends: Insect repellent sales are susceptible to changes in per capita disposable income
Some industry operators have shifted to producing natural and plant-based repellents
Despite the high cost of natural and plant-based insect repellents, they have proven increasingly popular
Industry operators are anticipated to continue focus on product development
The number of industry employees will continue to fall
Greater import penetration will undermine the industry's long-term growth prospects
Operators are slowly moving away from products that include potentially harmful chemical ingredients

market_segmentation.segment_description: Retailers are anticipated to constitute the largest downstream market for industry goods, accounting for an estimated 37.4% of industry revenue in 2022.

Exports represent a substantial market for this industry's products. However, the strength of the US dollar makes US goods more expensive for foreign consumers, mitigating the long-term growth potential of exports in this industry.
Wholesalers form an important link in the supply chain for insect repellents because they distribute industry products to retailers, pharmacies and sport and outdoor stores.

products_and_services.product_description: Liquid repellents are expected to account for 52.1% of industry revenue in 2022.
Aerosol repellents are expected to account for 16.8% of total industry revenue in 2022.
Other repellents are expected to represent 31.1% of total revenue in 2022.

tier_1_suppliers: Electric Power Transmission in the US
Industrial Machinery & Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Inorganic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
Organic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Drug, Cosmetic & Toiletry Wholesaling in the US
Pharmacies & Drug Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Health consciousness is a primary determinant of demand for industry products.
Operators have also been adversely affected by health concerns regarding DEET-based repellents.
Additional environmental concerns include ethical standards in the manufacturing process.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Over the five years to 2022, industry exports are estimated to increase at an annualized rate of 0.6%.
Industry imports have declined over the past five years.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has close more than one-quarter of the national population and covers 12 states.
The West is also a hub for industry activity.
The Plains region accounts for 13.5% of total industry establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The majority of insect repellent products are recognized as pesticides and must be registered with the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and with each state.
Some products are exempted from EPA regulation if their ingredients were considered minimum risk.
In response to COVID-19, the CDC released guidelines for businesses.

barriers_points.barrier_description: One of the largest potential barriers is the high degree of market share concentration.
Capital intensity in the industry is relatively high.
New operators must also establish a relationship with retailers and wholesalers.
Another major barrier is the growing level of government regulation.

basis_points.basis_title: Intellectual property rights for chemicals and compounds
basis_points.basis_description: Operators often compete based on intellectual property.
Product variety is one of the most important competitive factors.
Product efficacy is important in terms of competition.
Having an established distribution channel is important for stabilizing revenue.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top two companies account for 85% of revenue
concentration_points.concentration_description: In 2022, the two largest operators are expected to account for nearly 85.0% of total industry revenue.
These global consumer product companies have the capital and resources necessary to invest in new products.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are anticipated to account for 5.8% of industry revenue in 2020.
The bulk of the industry's costs are dedicated to purchasing chemical inputs.
Depreciation expenses comprise an estimated 2.3% of total revenue.
Marketing expenses are negligible in this industry.
In 2022, rental expenses comprise an estimated 0.9% of industry revenue.
Utility costs are anticipated to account for 1.0% of total revenue.
Industry operators must invest in research and development to achieve product differentiation.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Insect Repellent Manufacturing industry is expected to have a relatively high level of capital intensity.
In 2022, industry operators are expected to spend $0.36 on capital for every $1.00 spent on wages.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue volatility is moderate in the Insect Repellent Manufacturing industry.
Additionally, revenue volatility increased as a result of a steep decline in revenue amid the COVID-19 pandemic.
Moving forward, the industry remains susceptible to changes in consumer discretionary spending.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Industry operators are constantly looking to improve the product.
Companies have worked to develop natural products that are still able to repel insects.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Rising imports compete with our products on a cost basis due to their low-wage costs.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: We are able to specialize in a niche to better serve our specific customers.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: The price of crude oil, while there has been some volatility, has generally fallen over the past 10 years.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into setting up manufacturing facilities in lower-wage regions of the country?
FAQs.answer: Outsourcing manufacturing to low-cost regions greatly reduces wage-costs.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology, such as RFID tags?
FAQs.answer: Automation has greatly enhanced manufacturing capacity and standardization of products.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Automation has helped to curb wage costs for most of our employees.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations, such as energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: Participation in industry assistance groups and seminars keeps us aware of industry news and changes.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: We implement standard operating procedures that must be followed on a daily basis.

FAQs.question: How has input price volatility affected profit margins over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: Moderate volatility, coupled with high input prices have kept profit margin growth moderate.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Due to product and regional specialization, many customers stick with one brand.

FAQs.question: Does your company have a strong brand name? Have you fostered strong brand loyalty?
FAQs.answer: A reputable brand name is important to industry marketing.

FAQs.question: Do you get your research from an outside source or perform R&D internally? How can you use this research to make your product line better?
FAQs.answer: The search for safer and more efficient products has prompted companies to increase their R&D expenditure.

FAQs.question: How have you been affected by government policies?
FAQs.answer: Industry products have come under recent scrutiny due to some safety concerns.

FAQs.question: How have you dealt with negative effects of government policies?
Do you monitor the trade-weighted index? How have fluctuations in the value of the US dollar affected demand for your products?
FAQs.answer: An increase in the TWI signals the dollar is appreciating.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of rising disposable income levels? Do you manufacture high-margin products?
FAQs.answer: For many consumers, insect repellent is considered nonessential.

FAQs.question: How does rising manufacturing activity affect your company? How can you prepare for a rise in domestic demand?
FAQs.answer: Increases in the industrial production index indicate greater domestic manufacturing activity.
